page.title: 12Landscape in Caerhun Parish
page.content: The landscape of this area is centred around the valley of the River Ro. Its source is in the west of the area in open hillside. Giant electricity pylons are a striking feature on the higher ground. Whitewashed or grey stone cottages are scattered on the slopes. In the middle part of the valley the river flows through steeply wooded banks. On either side there are fields used mainly for pasture enclosed by dry-stone walls. Lower down, the valley opens out as it joins the wider valley of the River Conwy of which the Ro is a tributary. The village of Rowen is built along the west bank of the Ro. The highest point is in the south-west of the area, near Pen y Castell, at 1950 feet and the lowest point, in the Conwy valley, is 250 feet above sea level.
